metadata.title: CVE-2014-8132 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the ssh_packet_kexinit function in kex.c inlibssh 0.5.x and 0.6.x before 0.6.4 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service via a crafted kexinit packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.6.1-0ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-0ubuntu3.1').
